If the BBC wants to save money on new commissions it could follow ITV2's example and show Love Actually once every three weeks

To be clear: The only morally defensible form of torture is getting notes.

— Bitchuation (@Bitchuation) July 19, 2015

@Bitchuation Just have a few thoughts on the second act of this tweet in terms of overall structure...

— Tom Hall (@BRM) July 19, 2015

"Amantha? That's such an unusual name." FINALLY. #Rectify.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) July 19, 2015

Emmy nomination please for #Tig in whatever category it is eligible for in Emmy's after the one coming up. #Netflix #TigKeepsItReal

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) July 20, 2015

If I was on Jeopardy I'd answer every clue with "What is your problem, Alex?"

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) July 20, 2015

Aren't we all just looking for the Hoda to our Kathie Lee?

— Michael Arceneaux (@youngsinick) July 19, 2015

Well, this is officially the most disturbing thing I've ever seen. #Hannibal #S3E7

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 20, 2015

@TVMcGee I could genuinely name at least six scenes you could be referring to.

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 20, 2015

Rami Malek playing a character who does not like to be touched is a masochistic viewing test for viewers who undoubtedly want to touch him

— Nathaniel Rogers (@nathanielr) July 20, 2015

I wanna be strong. Really strong. Like, Katie Holmes not having written a tell-all yet strong.

— Chris Kelly (@imchriskelly) July 20, 2015

The start of a great journey begins with the viewing of your first Buffy episode.

— Whedonesque (@whedonesque) July 20, 2015

tweets.author_name: Michael would like Nazis kicked off of this site.
tweets.html:
If I was on Wheel of Fortune I'd just want to win the wheel

— Michael would like Nazis kicked off of this site. (@Home_Halfway) July 20, 2015

I'm pretty sure 13-year-old me tried to create Wayward Pines.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 20, 2015

A good postcredits sequence for a Marvel movie would be a CAA agent screaming into a phone about how many more of them his client has to do.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) July 20, 2015

Shelli got a letter from her dog. This is embarrassing. #BB17

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

John. I am so happy you exist this season. Please stay somehow. #BB17

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

Still can't figure out which Instagram filter they use to shoot Ray Donovan.

— Vanessa Ramos (@thatRamosgirl) July 20, 2015

There is a scene between Cameron and Tom in tonight's #HaltAndCatchFire that's so cute I think it gave me a headache. He is charming af.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

I hope that the first 20 minutes of tonight’s TRUE DETECTIVE just holds on the freeze frame from last week.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) July 20, 2015

Previously on #TrueDetective: BANG. Bang bang bang. Angst mustache. Circles under Vince Vaughn's eyes. Knives. Gloomy folk. Highway shots.

— Drew Morton (@thecinemadoctor) July 20, 2015

Imagine being so out of touch that writing a character like Taylor Kitsch's on True Detective feels edgy.

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) July 20, 2015

It's always so cute when HBO warns you that there will be "brief" nudity.

— Aaron Fullerton (@AaronFullerton) July 20, 2015

*contains facial hair spoilers for TRUE DETECTIVE*

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) July 20, 2015

Do you like listening to the details of business deals? What about depositions? Other boring stuff? Then #TrueDetective is the show for you!

— Lauren Chval (@lchval) July 20, 2015

"It's like blue balls...in your heart." Does this dialogue deserve an Emmy or what? #TrueDetective

— Lauren Chval (@lchval) July 20, 2015

"It's like blueballs...in your heart." I admire Vince Vaughn for getting these words out of his mouth. #TrueDetectiveSeason2

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 20, 2015

I'll keep watching "True Detective", but how did the line "It's like blue balls for your heart" make it through the editing process?

— Brian Stack (@BrianStack153) July 20, 2015

Kitschy sounds real Canadian when he screams. #TrueDetective

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

Will the next scene feature a manipulative woman, too? Frank's wife, maybe? #TrueDetective

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

Nope, not Frank's wife. Paul's mom! SO CLOSE. #TrueDetective

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

GUYS GUESS WHAT. Frank's wife too!!! #TrueDetective

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

All we need is Paul's lady and we have a manipulative woman royal flush. #TrueDetective

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 20, 2015

Nick Pizzolato reads too much James Ellroy

— Anne H. Stevens (@ahstevens1) July 20, 2015

Maybe this is all a TV movie the real true detectives are laughing at? Like, a dramatization of their actual case? #TrueDetectiveSeason2

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 20, 2015

Nic Pizzolatto actually Christopher Moltisanti—mystery solved. #TrueDetectiveSeason2 #Cleaver

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 20, 2015

"I am a fucking god-warrior."—Nic Pizzolatto, looking in the mirror every morning. #TrueDetectiveSeason2

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 20, 2015

This week on #TrueDetective, the characters act in believable ways.

PSYCH!

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 20, 2015

In the #TrueDetectiveSeason2 finale, the bar of doom’s morose chanteuse will be replaced by Carly Rae Jepsen.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) July 20, 2015

That Abigail Spencer is so good on 1 of the best & 1 of the worst shows I'm watching means something. #TrueDetectiveSeason2 #Rectify

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) July 20, 2015

Can't wait for the big reveal when Colin Farrell turns out to be Gossip Girl #TrueDetective

— Anne T. Donahue (@annetdonahue) July 20, 2015

I tried to look at this episode of TRUE DETECTIVE with fresh eyes. The detective stuff, not so bad. The domestic stuff, Jesus effing Christ.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) July 20, 2015

It's almost like asking a plagiarist for more television was a bad idea.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) July 20, 2015

I don't know what's happening on True Detective, but Deutschland 83 is making me want to be German in a disco with red lipstick.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 20, 2015

Vince Vaughn signed on to "True Detective" so he didn't have to buy his own cigarettes for a few months.

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 20, 2015

Figured out the real father of Colin Farrell's kid in True Detective pic.twitter.com/nDzg9w6o4V

— Joe Kwaczala (@joekjoek) July 20, 2015

That long close-up of the Colin Farrell acting-nado, though. In Bruges-level work. #TrueDetective

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) July 20, 2015

true detective season 2 is actually a diary of nic pizz's burgeoning cocaine addiction

— ☕netw3rk (@netw3rk) July 20, 2015

I want to see the #TrueDetective deleted scene of the Chief asking for Ray's badge and his stache. (HT to @Ch_eekyGirl.)

— Drew Morton (@thecinemadoctor) July 20, 2015

Pretty sure I'd stop going to that bar in True Detective. Not perking anyone up.

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) July 20, 2015

I dunno if the Kitsch asked you to get married, I prolly wouldn't question why even if I should bc I mean...#truedetectiveseason3

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) July 20, 2015

Torrential rain temporarily halted my satellite feed during "True Detective." To be filed under "Thank God for small favors."

— Brian Lowry (@blowryontv) July 20, 2015

Next Week on #TrueDetective: We try to make you think Colin Farrell is expendable...again!

— Drew Morton (@thecinemadoctor) July 20, 2015

The number 1 lesson TRUE DETECTIVE should take away from this season is, "It's OK to be funny. Funny makes up for a lot."

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) July 20, 2015

I would still watch a TRUE DETECTIVE S3 teaming up Colin Farrell and his mustache, as long as the mustache is voiced by McConaughey.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) July 20, 2015

"Ray Velcoro's mustache will return." Closing title card of TRUE DETECTIVE S2, in my imaginaiton.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) July 20, 2015

There is a lot to question on #TrueDetective, but nothing more than Ray's continued commitment to that bolo tie.

— melissa miller (@Serrae) July 20, 2015

New True Detective theory: HBO is showing the episodes out of order.

— Liana Maeby (@lianamaeby) July 20, 2015

Is this guitar player Nic Pizzolato's niece or something? Why the fuck do they keep giving her screen time? #TrueDetectiveSeason2

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 20, 2015

I have never been happier to see "Only three episodes left" as a caption. #TrueDetectiveSeason2

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 20, 2015

I think we can all agree at this point that our big mistake was wanting Nic Pizzolatto to write female leads. #TrueDetective

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) July 20, 2015

Like Kelly Reilly calling abortion "operations," and blaming herself for not being able to get pregnant--we should have known.

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) July 20, 2015

True Pet Detective is still a very good idea imo. Revitalise ur anthology show by adding more dogs imo.

— Sophie 🌹 (@insopherable) July 20, 2015

in one week we will have the new rick and morty and sunday night twitter will be worthwhile again

— Sophie 🌹 (@insopherable) July 20, 2015
